content.description:
This is a little short but sweet and powerful route from within The Alcove (formed by the gap between Woodstone & Half & Half Crag).

It is a overhanging small face.

This is the central route on Woodstone's short but striking uphill face.
content.location: On the eastern, uphill, face of Woodstone.

content.description:
"Splinter" is a short, steep, and varied route on that woodgrain granite. Super fun.

Climb through the first two bolts of bullet rock via a bouldery sequence (crux) and into a steep juggy section below a small roof. Launch into a short corner over the roof, choosing your own sequence between the arete and/or tricky face holds. Finishes all too quickly onto the slab.

This shares anchors with

Wailing Wall

. Thank you to the previous equippers at "Woodstone", Scott & Yuri Kimball and to J. Siegrist for the support and lending me his drill. It proved quite the little challenge after many years away from sport climbing. I hope you enjoy!
content.location: It is the farthest left route on the overhanging north face of Woodstone.

content.description: This climb ascends the left buttress as viewed from the east side of Woodstone. Start by face climbing into a small roof, and then continue through a series of small roofs above, which present different issues as you climb through them. The final section of the route involves mellow climbing to the chains.
content.protection: The route is protected with 7 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
The route is located on the east side of Woodstone between

Corner Joint

and

Electric Forest

.

climbs.name: Purple Haze
climbs.fa: Amos Patrick and Ben Bibee, July 2021

content.description:
Purple Haze is a fun, beginner route. Pull off the ground with a little, bulgy boulder problem, and then make your way out to the ridge where the exposure becomes pretty fantastic. Do a couple more steep-ish moves to a ledge. Use the chains for

Balsa

.

We bolted this on an evening with a lot of haze from the smoke of forest fires burning off to the west resulting in a beautiful sunset - thus the name.

Start off the ground at the bottom of the southwest corner just left of the arete. Climb up the face into a shallow, right-facing corner and using downpulls and underclings, and climb up and out of the corner onto the face above. Follow a right-facing, shallow corner to the right edge of a small ledge, and join

Dovetail

at the 5th bolt. Follow

Dovetail

, and climb the face above to reach the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and steel carabiners.
content.location: Pins & Tails is located on the west face just left of the arete near the southwest corner of Woodstone.

content.description: The first section of the route angles up and right and climbs through a couple tricky bulges flanked by hand cracks. Then mellow climbing leads to bolt 6 and the base of a bulging steep section which is the crux of the route. Climbing through this steep section follows the bolt line (bolts 7 to 10) with some movement slightly left of the arete on the face between bolts 9 and 10. Follow the bolt line here and do not climb right of the arete into the chimney that exits up and right toward P2 of Golden Staircase. Climbing through the crux has great exposure and the climbing involves technical punchy movement using side pulls, pinches and crimps along with tricky feet. The climbing above bolt 10 eases off and ascends the face just left of the arete to the anchors. Note: an onsight of Petrified while hanging the draws could be relatively harder, but with proper beta for the crux section a flash or repeat ascent could be relatively easier.
content.protection: 12 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and steel carabiners.
content.location:
Petrified is located on the buttress that forms the Northeast corner of Woodstone. It is located about 30 feet right of

Jigsaw

, and the start is about 10 feet lower. Note: there is a belay bolt tether located at the base of the route to help prevent the belayer from being pulled off the belay platform should the leader take a whip.

content.description: This climb ascends the center buttress on the east side of Woodstone. Start by stemming in an inset, then pass an overlap, and gain a short slab above. Then climb through the crux section of the route, which involves a series of overlaps with puzzling movement involving a mix of underclings, sidepulls, Gaston holds, pinches, and crimps. The final section of the route involves mellow climbing and provides a fun finish.
content.protection: The route is protected with10 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
The route is located on the center buttress on the east wall of Woodstone. It is located about 15 feet right of

Electric Forest

, and the start is about 10 feet lower.

content.description:
P1: (5.9, 1 star). Climb slabby rock which is a little dirty down low and end below the upper headwall on a large ledge with a 2 bolt anchor.

P2: (5.10c, 3 stars). Climb the colorful wall above near the arete on crisp edges. Pull two roofs with the second being the toughest.

There are two bolts at the top, but they are not set up to rappel. Either bring some slings, and downclimb to the nearby 5.12 anchors, or get your rope stuck.

Per

Doug Haller

: there is now a second rap at the far east side of the summit. It requires downclimbing to a chockstone and then some. This puts you in a better position for P3 and P4.
content.location: It is located on the NW corner at the low point of the rock.

content.description: Mahogany Swirl is a shorty but a goodie. Crimp up the beautiful swirly stone until a crimpy reach crux just below the finish.
content.protection:
Based on the okay from Jonathan, I added a 2nd bolt at the anchors and there is now a 2-bolt anchor with chains. - Bob Siegrist

3 bolts to a fixed single bolt lower.
content.location:
This pitch is technically on 'Half and Half' crag but it felt more natural to catalogue it here. From '

Corner Joint

,' look climber's right and see a short, slightly overhanging buttress facing towards Estes Park.

content.description:
Scientists have known for some time that trees can conduct electricity, but to extract electricity from the Woodstone and convert it into useful energy, you need to have a reliable source of power and technique.

The first bolt is easily clipped upon arrival from the chockstone boulder to the left, before shoeing up (recommended). Find your way to the first big undercling, and navigate engaging slab moves that trend right to a good hold in the seam. A powerful sequence leads to a good rest and a fun, airy sequence over the steepest part of the roof and onto the slab. An exposed fun 5.10 ride leads the rest of the way to the anchors. This is a photogenic and enjoyable route on good Twin Sister's granite. It is classic.

It is easy to access the anchors of "

Jigsaw

" from here and gear up for its sister route, if so inclined.
content.location:
This is the arete/face climb on the NE face of Woodstone between "

Roof Issues

" and "

Jigsaw

".

content.description: Start on the ground a few feet left of a large stone. Climb up the face using crimps and edges to reach bolt 1 (avoid stepping on the large stone). From bolt 1 follow the bolt line directly up and over a tricky bulge using crimps and sidepulls. You encounter the 1st crux getting to bolt 1 and the 2nd crux between bolts 3 and 4.  After clipping bolt 4, climb up the face above on steep featured rock to reach the anchors. Note: If you want to bypass the 1st crux you can step off the large stone to start the climb and ease the difficulty.
content.protection: There are 8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and steel carabiners.
content.location: Dovetail is located on the west face of the southwest corner of Woodstone.

content.description: Prepare for smeary feet but juggy underclings on this fun little arete. Some might want to stick clip the second bolt.
content.location:
It is on the uphill side of Woodstone to the right of '

Against the Grain

'.

climbs.name: Balsa
climbs.fa: A. Patrick, M. Thiess, B. Roshambeau, B. Bibee, B. Burell, R. Adams, June 2021

content.description: Balsa is a nice, little moderate on great stone.

Autumn Leaves climbs a fun, clean handcrack up to a ledge. Then step right into the chimney.

If you don't want to deal with the chimney or want to setup a toprope, you can use the chains above

Balsa

.
content.protection:
A light rack to the chains above

Balsa

. I have not done the chimney portion of the route so.... If you go to the top, there are several rap anchors to choose from.
content.location: When standing in the alcove between Woodstone and Half and Half, you will see a large inset on the left (SW) side of Woodstone. The route is the obvious handcrack splitting the wall that faces Half and Half.

climbs.name: Against the Joint
climbs.fa: Pinklebear, maybe? Some of the holds were chalked, so....

content.description:
Climb the first four bolts of

Against the Grain

. Match on the right, incut clipping hold at bolt four, then tick-tack on small crimps to slap right into the bowl. Make your way up the bowl to a good hold high and right from which you can cross-clip the last bolt on

Corner Joint

. Finish on

Corner Joint

.

This is very continuous with a hard, crimpy crux.
content.location:
Start on

Against the Grain

, and finish on

Corner Joint

.

content.description:
Against the Grain is an awesome, bouldery, little rig on great rock. Some tricky movement for the first three bolts leads to a good clipping hold and then the crux - some dynamic moves on perfect crimps up the steepest part of the wall.

The Kimballs installed an anchor on top of this unique feature in the mid 2000s (?). The uphill side of Woodstone is short, but the rock is awesome and steep! Now, with four great routes on this chunk of stone it is certainly worth the hike.

Also, if you wandered all of the way over here for this thing, you cannot leave until you try '

Purple Heart

,' 12+, on the steep south side of that incredible pillar just down from Woodstone. Find it listed under 'Slot Rock' on Mountain Project.
content.location: This is the steepest, longest route on this feature.

pathTokens: Woodstone, Half & Half, and Slot Rock
